titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B52
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B52

encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

1.[... ...] the tribe of Ḥāshidum in the town of [Naʿ]ḍ with the [tri-] 2.[be] of Ḥimyarum. And he led into battle 200 soldiers, and they conducted a raid 3.in the land of Ḥimyarum, and he killed therein a military leader. And (he made this dedication) because 4.he led into battle 150 soldiers in (the territory of the tribe of) Murād[um] 5.[in] the land of ʾAlhān, and he took captive therein two military leaders. And (he also made this dedication) [be-] 6.[cause] they attacked the army (of the enemy) in the region of Dalag, and he killed therein one 7.[military lead]er. And (he also made this dedication) because they clashed with the Ethiopians in the region of […] 8.[.], and he killed therein one military leader. And (he also made this dedication) because he commanded [the] tribe of 9.Maʿirbān--110 fighting men--and they attacked 10.Barqān, and he killed therein one military leader. And (he also made this dedication) because his [lo]rds the lineage of Hamdān sent [him] 11.their horses […] their […] 12.and he killed two chieftains, and all that […] in this […] 13.[…] in which ʾAbīkarib Yuhaskir threw down in humiliation 14.Dhū-Khaṭalim. And because Taʾlab granted him the birth 15.of many male children. And may [Taʾla]b continue to grant them 16.the esteem and good-pleasure of their lords of the lineage of Hamdān and 17.their tribe of Ḥāshidum and good crops in their field[s] 18.and their land. And may Taʾlab aid them 19.against the harm and malice of any enemy. By Taʾlab-[Riyā]mum, lord 20.of Raḥūbān.

the tribe of Ḥāshidum in the town of Naʿḍ with the tri-
be of Ḥimyarum. And he led into battle
soldiers, and they conducted a raid
in the land of Ḥimyarum, and he killed therein a military leader. And he made this dedication because
he led into battle
soldiers in the territory of the tribe of Murādum
in the land of ʾAlhān, and he took captive therein two military leaders. And he also made this dedication be-
cause they attacked the army of the enemy in the region of Dalag, and he killed therein one
military leader. And he also made this dedication because they clashed with the Ethiopians in the region of …
., and he killed therein one military leader. And he also made this dedication because he commanded the tribe of
Maʿirbān--
fighting men--and they attacked
Barqān, and he killed therein one military leader. And he also made this dedication because his lords the lineage of Hamdān sent him
their horses … their …
and he killed two chieftains, and all that … in this …
… in which ʾAbīkarib Yuhaskir threw down in humiliation
Dhū-Khaṭalim. And because Taʾlab granted him the birth
of many male children. And may Taʾlab continue to grant them
the esteem and good-pleasure of their lords of the lineage of Hamdān and
their tribe of Ḥāshidum and good crops in their fields
and their land. And may Taʾlab aid them
against the harm and malice of any enemy. By Taʾlab-Riyāmum, lord
of Raḥūbān.
